title: Odd Glory - Songs for Hymn (2015)
description:
"Songs for Hymn" is a collection of twelve standard Christian hymns.  But these aren't your typical songs of worship...each song is infused with unique instruments and ever-changing musical styles that inject new, often unexpected life into each of the tracks.

But even the most hardened traditionalists needn't worry: the vocal melodies remain unchanged, ensuring that you can immediately sing along to your favorite hymns right out of the gate.  The end result is a musical odyssey that manages to strike the tough balance of experimenting with the form, while still staying true to the spirit of the originals.

Also refreshing is its minimalist approach: the raw sound keeps everything simple and coherent, without overwhelming the songs with unnecessary extras. In other words, it will remind you of the little church in a small town, where it's all about the message, rather than the warehouse-sized churches of the city today, where large congregations and televised sermons focus on how to maximize donations and profits.  And isn't that what religion should be all about?

TRACK LISTING:
1.) Amazing Grace
2.) I'll Fly Away +
3.) A Mighty Fortress is Our God
4.) Leaning on the Everlasting Arms
5.) I Love to Tell the Story
6.) What a Friend We Have in Jesus
7.) Are You Washed in the Blood?
8.) Victory in Jesus +
9.) How Great Thou Art *
10.) Battle Hymn of the Republic
11.) God Be With You Till We Meet Again
12.) In the Garden

+ I'll Fly Away and Victory in Jesus under copyright to Albert E. Brumley & Sons. Recorded and included with permission from Clearbox Rights, LLC.

* How Great Thou Art under copyright to Stuart Hine Trust. Recorded and included with permission from EMI/CMG Publishing.

All other tracks are public domain.

All music arranged and recorded by Aaron Tom, except:
Vocals, backup vox on "Battle Hymn": Anna Belle
Backup vocals, vox on "Battle Hymn": Alani Keiser
Drums: Nathanael Graham

Engineered by Kevin Carafa
Mastered by Nathan Reiner (Matrix Audio)
Special thanks: Emily Tom & Ruth Wilt

For Grandpa
